video_description:
A video review of the most affordable Android Honeycomb 10" tablet, the Asus Eee Pad Transformer. Check out our full review at: http://www.mobiletechreview.com/tablets/Asus-Eee-Pad-Transformer.htm  The Transformer competes with the Motorola Xoom, Samung Galaxy Tab 10.1 and Acer Iconia Tab A500. It has the usual dual core 1GHz Tegra 2 CPU, a gig of RAM, 16 or 32 gigs of internal storage, a 9.5 hour battery, dual cameras, WiFi and Bluetooth with GPS. This is a WiFi-on tablet with a sharp 1280 x 800 IPS display. Asus sells a dock-keyboard combo that also adds a secondary battery and USB port for $149, hence the Transformer name.

Check out our video review of the Keyboard Dock for the Eee Pad Transformer: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4VLoGqsH3s4
title: Asus Eee Pad Transformer Review

comments.text:
Methinks the Mycloud app could be used to mirror the excellent Mobipocket Reader for Windows, therefore having something no other Android reader﻿ has, so far, a multi-dictionary text-search feature, for those of us who would like to properly study languages with our tablets.

The Mycloud support seems quick to support text search/highlighting without any major delay. If anyone tries it, I´d LOVE to know about it.

Cheers!

comments.text:
The Galaxy﻿ has a better screen than the Prime 1 but this one is cheaper and has an HDMI and micro or mini USB port as well as a micro SD slot, which can come pretty handy to transfer files, rooting and tethering. 

If you live in North America or Europe and do not care for connectivity wait a couple of days and you'll be getting a Transformer Prime with a quad-core CPU and Super LCD plus display but no USB port.

Take a look at her Prime review & choose.
